availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Frederick Kalfus (Bullitt County, Kentucky, physician, major (U.S.A.))

body.p: Bullitt County, Kentucky, physician and soldier. Shepherdsville, Kentucky, native. Son of Henry F. Kalfus and Matilda Kalfus. Married to Elizabeth V. Birkhead Kalfus in Bullitt County on June 7, 1854. Father of A. F. Kalfus, J. L. Kalfus, Lillie Kalfus. Graduate of Hanover College in 1852. Graduate of Kentucky School of Medicine in Louisville 1860. Physician in Bullitt County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain and major from 1861 to March 1, 1863. Unsuccessful Democratic candidate for Kentucky state treasurer in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bullitt, p. 209B.
